page.title: 08LOCAL LANDOWNER
page.content: Colonel Round has lived in Birch for 68 years. He has also lived in Birch Hall. Col.Round thinks the main change is{transport}in Birch. After the war he said there was hardly any petrol and villagers went by bike or walked. When he was a boy most people either worked for his father on the land or Huttons the local builders because they were the main employers. Now many people work in Colchester. Col.Round owns Birch Estate which is 4000 acres approximately. He hopes that his family will carry it on and will{farm}a great deal of it. He also hopes they will go on planting trees in the woods and other places. He thinks changes will happen in the gravel pits. When water collects there he hopes it will become useful for the public for fishing, wind surfing and swimming.
